table.name: MAF Sensor Scaling
MAF sensor

table.description: This is the scaling for the mass airflow sensor.

table.name: Fuel Sensor Scaling
Fuel sensor volts (assume 10bit AtoD = 0-5V)

table.description: This is the scaling for the fuel level sensor.

table.name: Intake Air Temperature Sensor Scaling
IAT sensor volts (assume 10bit AtoD = 0-5V)

table.description: This is the scaling for the IAT sensor.

table.name: Coolant Temperature Sensor Scaling
Coolant temperature sensor volts (assume 10bit AtoD = 0-5V)

table.description: This is the scaling for the coolant temperature sensor.

table.name: Gear Determination Thresholds Part 1
Gear Thresholds
table.data: Min 1st Gear
Max 1st Gear
Min 2nd Gear
Max 2nd Gear
Min 3rd Gear
Max 3rd Gear
Min 4th Gear
Max 4th Gear
Min 5th Gear
Max 5th Gear

table.description: The ECU estimates the current gear based on rpm and vehicle speed and these are the thresholds for that determination. These should not be modified unless the transmission gear ratios have changed from the original factory set-up.

table.name: Gear Determination Thresholds Part 2
Gear Thresholds
table.data: Min 6th Gear
Max 6th Gear

table.description: The ECU estimates the current gear based on rpm and vehicle speed and these are the thresholds for that determination. These should not be modified unless the transmission gear ratios have changed from the original factory set-up.

table.name: Shift Light Turn on Threshold

scaling.units: Engine speed (RPM) below redline to turn on shift light

table.name: Estimated Gear

table.description: The ECU uses the estimated gear in order to turn on the LED in the gauge cluster that indicates it is time to shift gear.

table.name: Idle Speed Target Increase vs Coolant Temp
Coolant Temperature

table.description: Idle speed target is adjusted at different coolant temperatures- this table shows how much to increase idle above the base of 500 rpm.

table.name: Idle Speed Target Increase vs Vehicle Speed
Vehicle Speed

table.description: Idle speed target is adjusted at different vehicle speed- this table shows how much to increase idle above the base of 500 rpm.

table.name: A/C on Idle Target Increase
Idle increase
table.data: Used when A/C is on

table.description: This is a constant offset which is added to the target idle setpoint if bit2 of the byte flag at $80368 is set.

table.name: Barometric Pressure Sensor Gain
Sensor Gain (assume 0-5V)
table.data: Pressure sensor gain

table.description: This is the scaling for the barometric pressure sensor. This sensor is in the ECU case.

table.name: Barometric Pressure Sensor Offset
Sensor Offset (assume 0-5V)
table.data: Pressure sensor offset

table.description: This is the zero-signal sensor reading for the barometric pressure sensor. This sensor is in the ECU case.

table.name: Relative Throttle Position Scaling

scaling.units: Fraction of zero corrected throt. pos. measurement

table.name: Relative throttle position scaling
table.data: Relative measurement gain

table.description: Relative throttle position is a value which is corrected for the zero-offset. This factor is multiplied by the difference in sensor reading to scale the relative magnitude.

table.name: Relative Throttle Position Zero Correction Scaling

scaling.units: Fraction of smallest throt. pos. measurement

table.name: Zero offset scaling
table.data: Throttle position zero offset gain

table.description: Relative throttle position is a value which is corrected for the zero-offset. This factor is multiplied by the smallest sensor reading to set up the zero offset.

table.name: Absolute Throttle Position Hysteresis Factor

scaling.units: Fraction of new meas to keep and of old meas to discard

table.name: Throt. pos. scaling
table.data: Throttle position gain

table.description: Throttle position is taken from an average of AtoD readings and of its previous position. This hysteresis factor selects how much weight the previous throttle position reading carries into the next throttle position measurement. Set this value to 1 to keep only the new measurement and set to 0 to keep only the old measurement.

table.name: Internal Engine Speed Byte Coefficient

scaling.units: TCR1 counts per time unit where one TCR1 count = 1.6 microsecond

table.name: Time conversion for internal engine speed byte
table.data: Numerator for Eng Spd calc

table.description: The $801be internal engine speed variable is used within the ECU to index many lookup tables. It is a byte representation of engine speed instead of the typical word length value. It is calculated as (coefficient)/(flywheel tooth count period) - offset .

table.name: Internal Engine Speed Byte Offset
Time conversion for internal engine speed byte
table.data: Offset for Eng Spd calc

table.description: The $801be internal engine speed variable is used within the ECU to index many lookup tables. It is a byte representation of engine speed instead of the typical word length value. It is calculated as (coefficient)/(flywheel tooth count period) - offset .

table.name: Time Delay between Delta Throttle Position Measurement
Time between throttle position measurements for delta throt. pos.
table.data: Time delay (Max 75)

table.description: The ECU calculates the rate of change of throttle position by taking a difference between values measured across this delay.

table.name: Threshold Rate of Throttle Change for Load Switching
Maximum magnitude of rate of change of throttle to allow load calculation switching
table.data: Maximum magnitude

table.description: The ECU sets a timer and changes load calculation behavior if the rate of change of throttle position is above this magnitude.

table.name: Timer Length for Load Calculation Switching After Large Throttle Rate of Change
Length of time after large throttle rate to allow load calculation switching
table.data: Timer setpoint

table.description: The ECU sets a timer to this value and changes load calculation behavior if the rate of change of throttle position is above a threshold.

table.name: Throttle Position Threshold for MAF-Free Load Calculation
Engine speed byte

table.description: The engine load calculation is forced to use a MAF sensor-free calculation if the throttle position is above this threshold.

table.name: Manifold Pressure Load-Scaling

scaling.units: Air load driven pressure increase in intake (mg air/kPa)

table.name: Engine speed byte

table.description: The engine load calculation includes corrections based on lookup values. One of the lookup values depends upon a calculated intake manifold pressure/vacuum. This table provides a scaling factor used to calculate the intake manifold pressure/vacuum.

table.name: Manifold Pressure Ambient-Pressure-Scaling
Engine speed byte

table.description: The engine load calculation includes corrections based on lookup values. One of the lookup values depends upon a calculated intake manifold pressure/vacuum. This table provides a value used to calculate the intake manifold pressure/vacuum.

table.name: MAF-Free Idle Load - IAC Flow (L_idle, L_iac-vac)

scaling.units: Idle Air Control Valve Flow (g air/sec)

table.name: Idle control setpoint
Calculated intake vacuum

table.description: The engine load calculation includes an accounting of idle control function. This table provides a value used to calculate the idle control related engine load when no engine position accounting errors exist.

table.name: MAF-Free Idle Load - Engine Off (L_idle, L_c)
Coolant Temperature

table.description: The engine load calculation includes an accounting of idle control function. This table provides a value used to calculate the idle control related engine load in case engine position accounting has errors.

table.name: MAF-Free Primary Load (L_ts)
Engine Speed Byte
Relative Throttle Position

table.description: The engine load calculation includes an estimation of air charge taken into the cylinders. This table provides a value that estimates primary load based on engine speed and throttle position. This value is used regardless of engine position accounting errors.

table.name: MAF-Free Load Temperature Correction (C, C_T)
Intake Air Temperature
Coolant Temperature

table.description: The engine load calculation includes an accounting of charge temperature. This table provides a value used to calculate temperature-based load correction when no engine position accounting errors exist.

table.name: Variable Valve Timing PWM control frequency
PWM frequency divisor
table.data: Camshaft phase control PWM frequency

table.description: This is a constant which divides the PWM8 channel base frequency. In the ECU, PWM8 has a reference of F_sys/64 = 20.001MHz/64 = 312.5 kHz.

table.name: Engine run time necessary before VVT becomes active
Engine Start Coolant Temperature

table.description: The value extracted from this table is compared to the engine runtime in order to determine if variable intake valve phasing should be activated yet.

table.name: Variable Valve Timing Proportional Control Gain
PID proportional gain
table.data: Camshaft phase control PWM proportional gain

table.description: VVT is controlled via a feedback loop. This constant is the error-proportional gain of the PID control.

table.name: Variable Valve Timing Integral Control Gain
PID integral gain
table.data: Camshaft phase control PWM integral gain

table.description: VVT is controlled via a feedback loop. This constant is the integrated-error gain of the PID control.

table.name: Low cam - Primary VVT target

scaling.units: Degree Intake Valve Advance (bigger numbers mean more valve overlap)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte
Engine load byte

table.description: Variable valve timing is set based on which camshaft profile is in use. The target is set based on engine speed and load and is corrected by subtracting a coolant temperature based lookup value.

table.name: High cam - Primary VVT target

scaling.units: Degree Intake Valve Advance (bigger numbers mean more valve overlap)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte
Engine load byte

table.description: Variable valve timing is set based on which camshaft profile is in use. The target is set based on engine speed and load and is corrected by subtracting a coolant temperature based lookup value.

table.name: Primary VVT engine temperature correction

scaling.units: Degree Intake Valve Retard (bigger numbers mean less valve overlap)

table.name: Coolant Temperature

table.description: Variable valve timing is set based on which camshaft profile is in use. The target is set based on engine speed and load and is corrected by subtracting a coolant temperature based lookup value.

table.name: Engage Variable Valve Lift RPM Threshold
Engine speed
table.data: Engine speed above which to allow change to high lift camshaft profile

table.description: Variable valve lift is actuated based on temperature and engine speed thresholds. There are two sets of thresholds, one for switching to each camshaft profile from the other. These lead to an adjustment of the PWM7 pulse width.

table.name: Disengage Variable Valve Lift RPM Threshold
Engine speed
table.data: Engine speed below which to force change to low lift camshaft profile

table.description: Variable valve lift is actuated based on temperature and engine speed thresholds. There are two sets of thresholds, one for switching to each camshaft profile from the other. These lead to an adjustment of the PWM7 pulse width.

table.name: Engage Variable Valve Lift Coolant Temperature Threshold
Coolant Temperature
table.data: Coolant Temperature above which to allow change to high lift camshaft profile

table.description: Variable valve lift is actuated based on temperature and engine speed thresholds. There are two sets of thresholds, one for switching to each camshaft profile from the other. These lead to an adjustment of the PWM7 pulse width.

table.name: Disengage Variable Valve Lift Coolant Temperature Threshold
Coolant Temperature
table.data: Coolant Temperature below which to force change to low lift camshaft profile

table.description: Variable valve lift is actuated based on temperature and engine speed thresholds. There are two sets of thresholds, one for switching to each camshaft profile from the other. These lead to an adjustment of the PWM7 pulse width.

table.name: Engage Variable Valve Lift PWM Pulse Width
Pulse Width
table.data: Setpoint for PWM7 when VVL engaged

table.description: Variable valve lift is actuated based on temperature and engine speed thresholds. There are two sets of thresholds, one for switching to each camshaft profile from the other. These lead to an adjustment of the PWM7 pulse width.

table.name: Disengage Variable Valve Lift PWM Pulse Width
Pulse Width
table.data: Setpoint for PWM7 when VVL disengaged

table.description: Variable valve lift is actuated based on temperature and engine speed thresholds. There are two sets of thresholds, one for switching to each camshaft profile from the other. These lead to an adjustment of the PWM7 pulse width.

table.name: Variable Valve Lift PWM control frequency
PWM frequency divisor
table.data: Camshaft lift control PWM frequency

table.description: This is a constant which divides the PWM7 channel base frequency. In the ECU, PWM7 has a reference of F_sys/64 = 20.001MHz/64 = 312.5 kHz.

table.name: Target A/F to Allow Closed Loop Fueling
A/F target that allows to closed loop fueling - any others disable it
table.data: Target A/F to Enter Closed Loop Fueling

table.description: Target A/F is compared to this calibration in order to transition out of open loop fueling. When target A/F is does not match this value, closed loop fueling is disabled. Other fueling parameters (A/F enrich) use this as a threshold too.

table.name: Minimum Engine Runtime Before Allowing Closed Loop Fueling
Engine-off coolant temperature (Deg. C)

table.description: This is the delay before trying to use closed loop fueling.

table.name: STFT Rich-Switch Threshold
Short term fuel trim switch limit
table.data: O2 sensor voltage to switch trimming direction (assume 0-5V AtoD)

table.description: The short term fuel trim changes by adding or subtracting a lookup value based on a lookup table. When the O2 sensor voltage reaches a threshold, the fuel trim switches direction (increasing to decreasing or vice versa). The primary value is scaled, then added or subtracted depending on O2 sensor status and a countdown timer.

table.name: STFT Lean-Switch Threshold
Short term fuel trim switch limit
table.data: O2 sensor voltage to switch trimming direction (assume 0-5V AtoD)

table.description: The short term fuel trim changes by adding or subtracting a lookup value based on a lookup table. When the O2 sensor voltage reaches a threshold, the fuel trim switches direction (increasing to decreasing or vice versa). The primary value is scaled, then added or subtracted depending on O2 sensor status and a countdown timer.

table.description: The short term fuel trim changes by adding or subtracting a lookup value based on a lookup table. When the O2 sensor voltage reaches a threshold, the fuel trim switches direction (increasing to decreasing or vice versa). The primary value is scaled, then added or subtracted depending on O2 sensor status and a countdown timer.

table.description: The short term fuel trim changes by adding or subtracting a lookup value based on a lookup table. When the O2 sensor voltage reaches a threshold, the fuel trim switches direction (increasing to decreasing or vice versa). The primary value is scaled, then added or subtracted depending on O2 sensor status and a countdown timer.

table.name: Idle LTFT Adjust Engine Speed Threshold
Engine speed below which idle LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Max engine speed for idle LTFT adjust

table.description: The idle correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the vehicle is at idle under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Idle LTFT Maximum MAF Threshold
Mass airflow below which idle LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Max MAF for idle LTFT adjust

table.description: The idle correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the vehicle is at idle under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Low Flow LTFT Minimum MAF Threshold
Mass airflow above which low flow LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Min MAF for low flow LTFT adjust

table.description: The low flow LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the vehicle is in a defined MAF range under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Low Flow LTFT Maximum MAF Threshold
Mass airflow below which low flow LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Max MAF for low flow LTFT adjust

table.description: The low flow LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the vehicle is in a defined MAF range under closed loop fueling.

table.name: High Flow LTFT Minimum MAF Threshold
Mass airflow above which high flow LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Min MAF for high flow LTFT adjust

table.description: The high flow LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the vehicle is above a defined MAF range under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Minimum coolant temperature for LTFT adjust
Coolant temperature above which LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Min coolant temperature for LTFT adjust

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the coolant is sufficiently warm under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Minimum air temperature for LTFT adjust
Air temperature above which LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Min intake air temperature for LTFT adjust

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the intake air is sufficiently warm under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Minimum ambient pressure for LTFT adjust
Atmospheric pressure above which LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Min air pressure for LTFT adjust

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the ambient pressure is sufficiently high under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Minimum fuel level for LTFT adjust
Fuel level above which LTFT can be adjusted
table.data: Min fuel level for LTFT adjust

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when the fuel level is sufficiently high under closed loop fueling.

table.name: Delay between LTFT adjustment
LTFT adjustment period
table.data: Min delay between LTFT adjustments

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when a timer with this value expires.

table.name: Maximum avg STFT else LTFT adjustment
Maximum average STFT threshold
table.data: Max. STFT before LTFT increase

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when average STFT exceeds threshold levels.

table.name: Minimum avg STFT else LTFT adjustment
Minimum average STFT threshold
table.data: Min. STFT before LTFT decrease

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection is only adjusted when average STFT exceeds threshold levels.

table.name: Idle LTFT Adjust Stepsize (I_lrn_step)
Stepsize to adjust injection pulse length correction
table.data: Injection pulse length change step size

table.description: The primary fueling control includes injection length for battery voltage compensation, for intake air accommodation and includes a third adjustment term (which changes in increments of this value).

table.name: Idle LTFT Low Limit
Low limit for injection pulse length correction
table.data: Injection pulse length correction minimum value

table.description: The primary fueling control includes injection length for battery voltage compensation, for intake air accommodation and includes a third adjustment term (limited to be above this value).

table.name: Idle LTFT High Limit
High limit for injection pulse length correction
table.data: Injection pulse length correction maximum value

table.description: The primary fueling control includes injection length for battery voltage compensation, for intake air accommodation and includes a third adjustment term (limited to be below this value).

table.name: Idle LTFT Low Limit else P0172
Low limit for injection pulse length correction
table.data: Injection pulse length correction minimum value before setting P0172

table.description: The primary fueling control includes injection length for battery voltage compensation, for intake air accommodation and includes a third adjustment term (limited to be above this value).

table.name: Idle LTFT High Limit else P0171
High limit for injection pulse length correction
table.data: Injection pulse length correction maximum value before setting P0171

table.description: The primary fueling control includes injection length for battery voltage compensation, for intake air accommodation and includes a third adjustment term (limited to be below this value).

table.name: Min load for low flow LTFT adjust
Minimum load allowed for low flow LTFT adjust
table.data: Load must be above this value for low flow LTFT adjustment

table.description: Low flow range LTFT is only adjusted during closed loop fueling if the engine load is within an acceptible range.

table.name: Max load for low flow LTFT adjust
Maximum load allowed for low flow LTFT adjust
table.data: Load must be below this value for low flow LTFT adjustment

table.description: Low flow range LTFT is only adjusted during closed loop fueling if the engine load is within an acceptible range.

table.name: Min load for high flow LTFT adjust
Minimum load allowed for high flow LTFT adjust
table.data: Load must be above this value for high flow LTFT adjustment

table.description: High flow range LTFT is only adjusted during closed loop fueling if the engine load is above this value.

table.name: Maximum low flow LTFT
Maximum allowable long term fuel trim
table.data: Largest LTFT under low flow

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection will not be adjusted beyond this value.

table.name: Minimum low flow LTFT
Minimum allowable long term fuel trim
table.data: Lowest LTFT under low flow

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection will not be adjusted beyond this value.

table.name: Maximum high flow LTFT
Maximum allowable long term fuel trim
table.data: Largest LTFT under high flow

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection will not be adjusted beyond this value.

table.name: Minimum high flow LTFT
Minimum allowable long term fuel trim
table.data: Lowest LTFT under high flow

table.description: The LTFT correction for fuel injection will not be adjusted beyond this value.

table.name: Minumum intake air temperature for close loop fueling
Min. IAT for STFT active
table.data: Intake air temperature

table.description: The short term fuel trim is not activated if IAT is below this threshold level.

table.name: Injector Pulse Length Battery Voltage Compensation (V_lat)
Battery Voltage

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for battery voltage. This value is added to the base injection length.

table.name: Engine Speed Redline Limp Mode Reduction
Engine speed redline reduction
table.data: Limp mode redline offset

table.description: The engine speed redline is set by adding to the base level of 6000 an extra amount depending on coolant temperature, and subtracting a limp mode offset.

table.name: Engine Speed Redline Temperature Addition
Coolant Temperature
Time

table.description: The engine speed redline is set by adding to the base level of 6000 an extra amount depending on coolant temperature and a timer count and subtracting a limp mode offset.

table.name: Engine Speed Redline Offset To Evaluate Misfire
Engine speed below redline
table.data: Evaluate misfire conditions when at least this far below redline

table.description: Engine speed is compared to this offset beyond redline.

table.name: Open ACIS Airbox Flap Threshold
Engine speed
table.data: Engine speed above which deactivate the selenoid (Open the flap)

table.description: The flap on the original airbox.

table.name: Close ACIS Airbox Flap Threshold
Engine speed
table.data: Engine speed below which activate the selenoid (Close the flap)

table.description: The flap on the original airbox.

table.name: Cranking Injector Pulse Length Coolant Temperature Compensation (I_cool't_temp)
Engine-Off Coolant Temperature

table.description: The injector pulse length is applied during cranking via the time processor unit's output compare mode. The full cranking injection length includes both coolant temperature and battery voltage compensation.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Intake Air Temperature Correction (C_a)

scaling.units: Correction factor multiplied with base fuel pulse length (range: 0-2)

table.name: Intake Air Temperature

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for Intake air temperature. This value is multiplied to the 'base fuel needed' injection length.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Coolant Temperature/Engine Load Correction (C_cl)

scaling.units: Correction factor multiplied with base fuel pulse length (range: 0-4)

table.name: Engine Load Byte
Coolant Temperature

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for engine charge temperature (coolant temperature and engine load). This value is multiplied to the 'base fuel needed' injection length.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Coolant Temperature/MAF Ramp Correction (C_cm)

scaling.units: Correction factor multiplied with base fuel pulse length (range: 0-8)

table.name: Engine-Off Coolant Temperature
Cumulative Mass Airflow

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for accumulating MAF. This value is multiplied to the 'base fuel needed' injection length. The MAF ramp variable is still strange to me- this is likely to change in the future.

table.name: Base Fuel Target Air/Fuel Ratio (A/F_cmd)
Engine Speed Byte
Engine Load Byte

table.description: The injector pulse length base fuel amount is calculated as the ratio of (engine load)/(target A/F +extra enrich A/F). This value is the target A/F ratio.

table.name: A/F enrich ignition advance scaling factor (C_ign)

scaling.units: A/F enrichment per ignition advance deg. BTDC

table.name: Scaling factor for target A/F enrichment
table.data: Ignition advance based A/F target reduction scaling

table.description: When commanded A/F is richer than STFT-active value, the A/F is enrichened to compensate for ignition advance (based on coolant temp, knock, eng spd and IAT).

table.name: Fuel Injection Correction Factor (10000/VE)
Engine Speed Byte
Engine Load Byte

table.description: The requested base fuel mass amount is calculated as the ratio of (engine load)/(target A/F + extra enrich A/F). The load/(A/F) mass value is then multiplied by this value to give an injection length in microseconds.

table.name: Fuel Injection Crank Angle Target
Engine Speed Byte
Engine Load Byte

table.description: The target engine position to begin fuel injection is based on this lookup table (with an offset for each cylinder's relative position).

table.name: Tip-in throttle rate activation threshold (trans_delta_tp_hi)
Minimum throttle rate to enable tip-in correction
table.data: Throttle rate must exceed this in order to trigger corrective action

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This threshold is the positive limit before tip-in corrections begin being applied.

table.name: Tip-out throttle rate activation threshold (trans_delta_tp_low)
Maximum throttle rate to enable tip-out correction
table.data: Throttle rate must exceed this in order to trigger corrective action

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This threshold is the negative limit before tip-out corrections begin being applied.

table.name: Tip-in throttle rate upper limit (trans_delta_tp_limit_hi)
Maximum tip-in throttle rate allowed
table.data: Tip-in throttle rate will be constrained this value during corrective action

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This threshold is the positive limit for tip-in corrections.

table.name: Tip-out throttle rate lower limit (trans_delta_tp_limit_low)
Minimum tip-out throttle rate allowed
table.data: Tip-out throttle rate will be constrained this value during corrective action

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This threshold is the negative limit for tip-out corrections.

table.name: Tip-in magnitude reduction period (period_trans_delta_tp_reduc)
Tip-in is reduced at this period
table.data: Delay between tip-in reduction steps

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value dictates the delay between tip-in magnitude reductions after throttle rate has settled.

table.name: Tip-out magnitude reduction period (period_trans_delta_tp_inc)
Tip-out is reduced at this period
table.data: Delay between tip-out reduction steps

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value dictates the delay between tip-out magnitude reductions after throttle rate has settled.

table.name: Tip-in magnitude reduction step size (trans_delta_tp_reduc)
Engine speed byte

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. The rapid throttle change is recorded as a tip-in or tip-out magnitude. This table shows the size of the magnitude reduction step once throttle rate has settled.

table.name: Tip-out magnitude reduction step size (trans_delta_tp_inc)
Engine speed byte

table.description: Fueling and ignition advance have corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. The rapid throttle change is recorded as a tip-in or tip-out magnitude. This table shows the size of the magnitude reduction step once throttle rate has settled.

table.name: Open Loop: Scaling factor for all open loop fueling corrections (C_TtoF)

scaling.units: microsecond injector pulse per delta (%throt pos)/ms

table.name: Coefficient for open loop fueling
table.data: This factor is multiplied with tip-in, tip-out and catalyst reactivation open loop fueling pulses

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into each of the three open loop fueling parameters in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

table.name: Open Loop: Tip-in neutral gear correction (C_gear_0)
Coefficient for tip-in, open loop fueling
table.data: This factor is multiplied with tip-in open loop fueling pulses

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-in open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

Coefficient for tip-in, open loop fueling
table.data: This factor is multiplied with tip-in open loop fueling pulses

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-in open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

Coefficient for tip-in, open loop fueling
table.data: This factor is multiplied with tip-in open loop fueling pulses

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-in open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-in open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

table.data: This factor is multiplied with tip-in open loop fueling pulses

Coefficient for tip-in, open loop fueling
table.data: This factor is multiplied with tip-in open loop fueling pulses

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-in open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

Engine speed byte

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-in open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

Coolant Temperature

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-in open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

Engine speed byte

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-out open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

Coolant Temperature

table.description: Fueling has open loop corrections that depend on rapid changes in throttle. This value is multiplied into tip-out open loop fueling in order to scale the magnitude of the response.

table.name: DFSO: minimum engine runtime to allow activation
DFSO will not be activated before warmup.
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off cannot occur before this time delay has passed.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: minimum engine speed for activation
Above this engine speed, DFSO can activate
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off only occurs if the engine is spinning sufficiently fast.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: maximum engine speed for deactivation
Below this engine speed, DFSO will be deactivated
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off only occurs if the engine is spinning sufficiently fast.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: minimum coolant temperature to allow activation
Above this tempeature, DFSO can activate
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off only occurs if the engine is sufficiently warm.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: maximum coolant temperature for deactivation
Below this tempeature, DFSO will be deactivated
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off only occurs if the engine is sufficiently warm.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: minimum vehicle speed to allow activation
Above this speed, DFSO can activate
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off only occurs if the vehicle is moving sufficiently fast.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: maximum vehicle speed for deactivation
Below this speed, DFSO will be deactivated
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off only occurs if the vehicle is moving sufficiently fast.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: maximum throttle position for activation
Below this throttle position, DFSO will be activated
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off occurs if all other conditions are met and the throttle is sufficiently closed.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: minimum throttle position for deactivation
Above this throttle position, DFSO will be deactivated
table.data: Deceleration fuel shut off occurs if all other conditions are met and the throttle is sufficiently closed.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: DFSO: activation delay to allow gear shift
DFSO will not be activated until this timer has expired
table.data: A delay is used before activating deceleration fuel shut off in order to allow for gear shift without DFSO.

table.description: In order to save fuel, the ECU will shut off fuel if the car is coasting with the throttle closed. This parameter is a limit related to activating the deceleration fuel shutoff function.

table.name: Open Loop: reduction scaling factor for catalyst reactivation (C_react-reduc)
The extra fuel pulse for catalyst reactivation is reduced by this factor
table.data: At each crank tooth count (10 degree rotation) the active catalyst reactivation pulse is scaled by this factor.

table.description: During DFSO the catalyst is oxidized. An open loop fueling correction can be used to reactivate the catalyst. This parameter reduces the magnitude of that open loop correction over time.

table.name: Open Loop: Catalyst reactivation after DFSO fuel pulse correction (T_angle)
Engine rotations during deceleration fuel shutoff

table.description: This is an open loop fueling correction. During deceleration fuel shutoff the catalyst accumulates oxygen and must receive an extra fuel pulse in order to properly reduce NOx. This parameter provides the magnitude of the correction.

table.name: Spark firing length battery voltage correction
Engine Speed Byte
Battery Voltage

table.description: The ignition firing time has a battery voltage compensation which is taken from this table.

table.name: Time after startup to use cranking ignition advance
Timer initialization value
table.data: Amount of time to use cranking ignition advance value

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If this counter is not zero, it defaults to using a timing value based only on coolant temperature.

table.name: Cranking ignition advance (A_cranking)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine-off coolant temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If this counter is not zero, it defaults to using a timing value based only on coolant temperature.

table.name: Throttle position maximum threshold to use idle ignition advance
Throt pos maximum value
table.data: Below this throttle position, the engine idle value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If throttle position is below this threshold, it looks at the engine speed relative to the idle target to determine if the alternate, idle ignition advance table should be used.

table.name: Engine speed above idle target maximum threshold to use idle ignition advance
Engine speed above idle maximum value
table.data: When the engine speed - target idle engine speed is below this value, an the engine idle value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the (engine speed - target idle engine speed) is below this threshold and the throttle position was low enough, the car will use an alternate, idle ignition advance table.

table.name: Engine speed above idle target minimum threshold to use idle ignition advance-idle drop catch
Engine speed above idle maximum value
table.data: When the engine speed - target idle engine speed is above this value, the vehicle is stopped, and engine speed is falling too rapidly a constant value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the (engine speed - target idle engine speed) is above this threshold, the vehicle is not moving, and the rate of change of the engine speed is too negative, the car will use an alternate ignition advance constant calibration.

table.name: Delta engine speed minimum threshold to use idle ignition advance-idle drop catch
Delta engine speed
table.data: When the engine speed changes at a rate lower (more negative) than this value, the vehicle is not moving and the engine is at idle a constant value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is slowing too fast, (engine speed - target idle engine speed) is above its threshold, and the vehicle is not moving, the car will use an alternate ignition advance constant calibration.

table.name: Idle ignition advance-idle drop catch (A_idle-catch)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Idle engine speed drop ignition advance
table.data: If the vehicle is stopped, throttle closed, and engine speed falls too fast then this constant value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is slowing too fast, (engine speed - target idle engine speed) is above its threshold, and the vehicle is not moving, the car will use an alternate ignition advance constant calibration.

table.name: Idle ignition advance A/C-on correction (A_A/C)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Idle ignition advance A/C correction
table.data: If the vehicle is at idle (according to above thresholds), and a memory flag is set then this value is added to the ignition advance

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, the car will use an alternate ignition advance calculation. This calibration is added to the calculated value under certain conditions.

table.name: Idle ignition advance coolant temperature correction (A_c)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Coolant temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Vehicle speed above which to use alternate idle ignition advance target idle correction
Vehicle speed threshold
table.data: If vehicle speed is higher than this value, use an alternate correction for idle ignition advance based on the difference between engine speed and target idle speed

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the a certain correction to the ignition advance is used.

table.name: Idle ignition advance offset from target idle correction - above spd thresh (A_it)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Difference between engine speed and target idle

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Idle ignition advance offset from target idle correction - below spd thresh (A_it)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Difference between engine speed and target idle

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Idle ignition advance intake air temperature correction (A_iat)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Intake air temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Idle ignition advance rate of change of engine speed correction (A_es)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Rate of change of engine speed crank period (larger period is slower rpm)

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Deceleration fuel shutoff ignition advance (A_DFSO)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Ignition advance used when fuel shut off during deceleration
table.data: If the vehicle is under open loop fueling due to decel fuel shutoff, this value is used as ignition advance

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. When under open loop fueling due to load or fuel cut, use this value.

table.name: Minimum allowable ignition advance

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Minimum ignition advance
table.data: If calculated ignition advance is lower (more negative) than this value, use this byte

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value is used to limit the allowable ignition advance.

table.name: Maximum engine-off coolant temperature for cumulative MAF correction of primary ignition advance
Maximum engine-off coolant temperature
table.data: If engine-off coolant temperature is greater than this value, use a coefficient of 1 for the speed-load primary ignition advance

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the primary ignition advance is used.

table.name: Minimum engine-off coolant temperature for cumulative MAF correction of primary ignition advance
Minimum engine-off coolant temperature
table.data: If coolant temperature is lower than this value, use a coefficient of 1 for the speed-load primary ignition advance

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the primary ignition advance is used.

table.name: Maximum throttle position for cumulative MAF correction of primary ignition advance
Maximum throttle position
table.data: If throttle position is higher than this value, use a coefficient of 1 for the speed-load primary ignition advance

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the primary ignition advance is used.

table.name: Cumulative MAF correction for primary speed-load ignition advance (c_mr)
Cumulative Mass Airflow

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is running with coolant temperature in a defined range, and throttle position below a threshold, then the primary ignition advance lookup value based on engine speed and load will be scaled by this value. The MAF ramp is a strange variable that appears to increase at startup until it saturates. It is only reset at engine off.

table.name: Primary ignition advance (A_sl)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte
Engine Load Byte

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table represents the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Primary ignition advance intake air temperature correction (A_iat)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Intake air temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table is added to the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Primary ignition advance coolant temperature coefficient for engine speed correction (C_c)

scaling.units: Coefficient for engine speed correction of ignition advance (range 0-2)

table.name: Coolant temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table is multiplied to the lookup based on engine speed before being added to the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Primary ignition advance engine speed correction (A_spd)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table is multiplied to the coefficient based on coolant temperature before being added to the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Primary ignition advance transient delta throttle position correction (A_delta_tp)

scaling.units: Ignition retard (degree after top dead center)

table.name: Transient delta throttle postion (tip-in magnitude)

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table is subtracted from the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Ignition advance rate of change

scaling.units: d(Ignition advance)/d(time) (degree before top dead center/50 millisecond)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte
Throttle Position

table.description: The ECU adjusts ignition advance once every 50ms. The value from this table represents the step taken in ignition advance at each change toward the programmed target.

table.name: Knock Signal Baseline Averaging Hysteresis Factor (a_kn)

scaling.units: Fraction of new meas to keep and of old meas to discard

table.name: Signal scaling
table.data: Knock sensor signal fraction

table.description: Knock sensor signal baseline is taken from an average of AtoD readings and of its previous position. This hysteresis factor selects how much weight the previous reading carries into the next measurement. Set this value to 1 to keep only the new measurement and set to 0 to keep only the old measurement.

table.name: Knock Signal Baseline Averaging - Knock Active Offset (V_kA)
Signal Offset
table.data: Knock sensor baseline offset

table.description: The knock signal is compared to an average baseline level in order to determine if knock is active. If knock is active, the baseline average is updated by adding this parameter.

table.name: Threshold Knock-Active Signal (S_knock-threshold)
Engine Speed Byte
Engine Load Byte

table.description: Knock intensity is calculated by subtracting this baseline value from the processed knock sensor signal. If the difference is positive, then knock is active.

table.name: Transient Knock Correction (A_transient-knock-corr)

scaling.units: Ignition retard (-degree before top dead center)

table.name: Knock Intensity Byte

table.description: The ECU compensates for transient knock by retarding ignition advance additionally by the amount in this table each time knock is detected.

table.name: Transient Knock Correction Limit (A_tr-kn-limit)

scaling.units: Ignition retard (-degree before top dead center)

table.name: Maximum ignition retard correction step
table.data: Ignition retard corrective step-size limit

table.description: The ECU compensates for transient knock by retarding ignition advance proportional to the intensity of the knock. If the knock-intensity based lookup table produced a larger correction than this value, use this value to correct ignition retard.

table.name: Transient Knock Correction Reduction Step (A_kt-reduc)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Ignition retard reduction
table.data: Transient knock is reduced by this step periodically

table.description: The ECU reduces transient knock correction by periodically subtracting this value from ignition retard.

table.name: Transient Knock Correction Reduction Period (T_kt-reduc)

scaling.units: Delay between reduction steps in transient knock (ms)

table.name: Time Delay (ms)
table.data: Transient knock is reduced at this period

table.description: The ECU reduces transient knock correction by subtracting a value from ignition retard once per this value time steps.

table.name: Knock Sum Increment Coefficient (C_k-sum)

scaling.units: Coefficient for adding knock to the sum (a.u., max 255)

table.name: Weight factor
table.data: Multiply Transient Knock Correction by this factor before adding to the sum

table.description: The ECU collects transient knock into a sum after multiplying by this factor.

table.name: Knock Sum Decrement Step (A_k-sum-reduc)

scaling.units: Step size for removing knock from the sum (a.u., max 255)

table.name: Knock sum reduction step
table.data: Subtract this factor from the sum if no transient knock is active.

table.description: The ECU reduces the collected transient knock by this factor if no transient knock is active.

table.name: Knock correction ignition advance (A_ka)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte
Engine Load Byte

table.description: The ECU corrects for the sum of transient knock by multiplying the difference between A_sl (primary speed-load ignition advance) and this value.

table.name: OBD mode 0x2F injector actuation session active time
Actuation active time
table.data: The injector pulse train remains active for this amount of time

table.description: OBD mode 0x2F allows injector actuation commands. This parameter dictates how long the ECU continues to actuate the injector pulse train.

table.name: OBD mode 0x2F injector actuation delay between pulses
Actuation delay time
table.data: This much delay occurs between pulse events

table.description: OBD mode 0x2F allows injector actuation commands. This parameter dictates how long the ECU waits between injector pulses as part of the pulse train.

table.name: OBD mode 0x2F injector actuation pulse length
Actuation pulse time
table.data: Injector pulse length

table.description: OBD mode 0x2F allows injector actuation commands. This parameter dictates how long the ECU holds the injector pulse active as part of the pulse train.

table.name: Coolant Temperature Sensor Scaling
Coolant temperature sensor volts (assume 10bit AtoD = 0-5V)

table.description: This is the scaling for the coolant temperature sensor.

table.name: Internal Engine Speed Byte Coefficient

scaling.units: TCR1 counts per time unit where one TCR1 count = 1.6 microsecond

table.name: Time conversion for internal engine speed byte
table.data: Numerator for Eng Spd calc

table.description: The $801be internal engine speed variable is used within the ECU to index many lookup tables. It is a byte representation of engine speed instead of the typical word length value. It is calculated as (coefficient)/(flywheel tooth count period) - offset .

table.name: Internal Engine Speed Byte Offset
Time conversion for internal engine speed byte
table.data: Offset for Eng Spd calc

table.description: The $801be internal engine speed variable is used within the ECU to index many lookup tables. It is a byte representation of engine speed instead of the typical word length value. It is calculated as (coefficient)/(flywheel tooth count period) - offset .

table.name: Injector Pulse Length Battery Voltage Compensation (V_lat)
Battery voltage (assume 10bit AtoD scaled same as T4)

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for battery voltage. This value is added to the base injection length.

table.name: Injector Pulse Length Battery Voltage Compensation Scaling (C_i)
multiplier
table.data: Multiply the microsecond length of the battery correction for injection length

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for battery voltage. This value is multiplied with the battery correction before being added to the base injection length.

table.name: Cranking Injector Pulse Length Coolant Temperature Compensation (I_cool't_temp)
Engine Off Coolant Temperature

table.description: The injector pulse length is applied during cranking via the time processor unit's output compare mode. The full cranking injection length includes both coolant temperature and battery voltage compensation.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Intake Air Temperature Correction (C_a)

scaling.units: Correction factor multiplied with base fuel pulse length (range: 0-2)

table.name: Intake Air Temperature

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for Intake air temperature. This value is multiplied to the 'base fuel needed' injection length.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Coolant Temperature Correction (C_c)

scaling.units: Correction factor multiplied with base fuel pulse length (range: 0-4)

table.name: Coolant Temperature

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for engine coolant temperature. This value is multiplied to the 'base fuel needed' injection length.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Coolant Temperature/Camshaft Count Correction (C_cc)

scaling.units: Correction factor multiplied with base fuel pulse length (range: 0-8)

table.name: Camshaft advance/sensor output count (ramps up to max at 4094)
Engine Off Coolant Temperature

table.description: The injector pulse length includes correction for variable valve timing position. This value is multiplied to the 'base fuel needed' injection length.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Primary Scaling Factor (C_fp)

scaling.units: Coefficient multiplied with base fuel pulse length

table.name: Scaling factor
table.data: Multiply with base microsecond length fuel injection length

table.description: The primary injector pulse length is determined based on which sensors are available. This value is multiplied to the 'base fuel needed' injection length.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Primary Offset (O_fp)

scaling.units: Offset for base fuel pulse length

table.name: Offset factor
table.data: Add to base microsecond length fuel injection length before applying correction factors

table.description: The primary injector pulse length is determined based on which sensors are available. This value is added to the 'base fuel needed' injection length before corrections are applied.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Primary Value (F_p-ms)
Engine Speed Byte
Manifold Absolute Pressure

table.description: The injector pulse length (base fuel needed) value comes from this lookup table.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Alternate Primary Value (C_p-ts)
Engine Speed Byte
Relative Throttle Position

table.description: The injector pulse length (base fuel needed) value comes from this lookup table in case the MAP sensor data is unavailable.

table.name: Base Fuel Injector Pulse Length Alternate Primary Value (C_p-s)
Engine Speed Byte

table.description: The injector pulse length (base fuel needed) value comes from this lookup table in case the manifold absolute pressure sensor data is unavailable and the throttle position sensor data is unavailable.

table.name: Fuel Injection Crank Angle Target
Engine Speed Byte
Manifold Absolute Pressure

table.description: The target engine position to begin fuel injection is based on this lookup table (with an offset for each cylinder's relative position).

table.name: Spark firing length battery voltage correction
Engine Speed Byte
Battery Voltage

scaling.units: Volts, assume 10bit AtoD scaled same as T4

table.description: The ignition firing time has a battery voltage compensation which is taken from this table.

table.name: Time after startup to use cranking ignition advance
Timer initialization value
table.data: Amount of time to use coolant temperature based cranking ignition advance value

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If this counter is not zero, it defaults to using a timing value based only on coolant temperature.

table.name: Cranking ignition advance (A_cranking)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine-off coolant temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If this counter is not zero, it defaults to using a timing value based only on coolant temperature.

table.name: Throttle position maximum threshold to use idle ignition advance
Throt pos maximum value
table.data: Below this throttle position, an alternate value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If throttle position is below this threshold, it looks at the engine speed relative to the idle target to determine if the alternate, idle ignition advance table should be used.

table.name: Engine speed above idle target maximum threshold to use idle ignition advance
Engine speed above idle maximum value
table.data: When the engine speed - target idle engine speed is below this value, an alternate value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the (engine speed - target idle engine speed) is below this threshold and the throttle position was low enough, the car will use an alternate, idle ignition advance table.

table.name: Delta engine speed minimum threshold to use idle ignition advance-idle drop catch
Delta engine speed
table.data: When the engine speed changes at a rate lower (more negative) than this value, the vehicle is not moving and the engine is at idle a constant value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is slowing too fast, (engine speed - target idle engine speed) is above its threshold, and the vehicle is not moving, the car will use an alternate ignition advance constant calibration.

table.name: Idle ignition advance-idle drop catch (A_idle-catch)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Idle engine speed drop ignition advance
table.data: If the vehicle is stopped, throttle closed, and engine speed falls too fast then this constant value of ignition advance is used

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is slowing too fast, (engine speed - target idle engine speed) is above its threshold, and the vehicle is not moving, the car will use an alternate ignition advance constant calibration.

table.name: Maximum coolant temperature for camshaft ramp/count correction of ignition advance
Maximum coolant temperature
table.data: If coolant temperature is greater than this value, do not correct ignition advance for the camshaft rotation count

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the a certain correction to the ignition advance is used.

table.name: Minimum coolant temperature for camshaft ramp/count correction of ignition advance
Minimum coolant temperature
table.data: If coolant temperature is lower than this value, do not correct ignition advance for the camshaft rotation count

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the a certain correction to the ignition advance is used.

table.name: Maximum throttle position for camshaft ramp/count correction of ignition advance
Maximum throttle position
table.data: If throttle position is higher than this value, do not correct ignition advance for the camshaft rotation count

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the a certain correction to the ignition advance is used.

table.name: Idle ignition advance coolant temperature correction (A_c)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Coolant temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Vehicle speed above which to use alternate idle ignition advance target idle correction
Maximum vehicle speed
table.data: If vehicle speed is higher than this value, use an alternate correction for idle ignition advance based on the difference between engine speed and target idle speed

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. This value puts a bound on operating parameters where the a certain correction to the ignition advance is used.

table.name: Idle ignition advance offset from target idle correction - above spd thresh (A_it)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Difference between engine speed and target idle

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Idle ignition advance offset from target idle correction - below spd thresh (A_it)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Difference between engine speed and target idle

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Idle ignition advance intake air temperature correction (A_iat)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Intake air temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, ignition advance is the sum of corrections based on coolant temperature, engine speed relative to target idle, fractional change in engine speed, and intake air temperature.

table.name: Idle ignition advance A/C-on correction (A_A/C)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Idle ignition advance
table.data: If the vehicle is at idle, and a memory flag is set then this value is added to the ignition advance - in the K4 ROM so far this value appears to be unused

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is at idle, the car will use an alternate ignition advance calculation. This calibration is added to the calculated value under certain conditions.

table.name: Camshaft ramp/count correction for ignition advance (A_cam)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Camshaft advance/sensor output count (ramps up to max at 4094)

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. If the engine is running with coolant temperature in a defined range, and throttle position below a threshold, then both the primary and idle ignition advance lookup values include an added offset based on this value. The camshaft ramp is a strange variable that appears to increase at startup until it saturates. It is only reset at engine off.

table.name: Deceleration fuel shutoff ignition advance (A_DFSO)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Ignition advance during deceleration fuel shutoff
table.data: If the vehicle is under open loop fueling due to deceleration fuel shutoff, this value is used as ignition advance

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. When under open loop fueling due to load or fuel cut, use this value.

table.name: Primary ignition advance intake air temperature correction (A_iat)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Intake air temperature

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table is added to the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Primary ignition advance (A_p-ms)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte
Manifold Absolute Pressure

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table represents the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Alternate primary ignition advance (A_p-ts)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte
Relative Throttle Position

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table represents the primary ignition advance.

table.name: Alternate primary ignition advance (A_p-s)

scaling.units: Ignition advance (degree before top dead center)

table.name: Engine Speed Byte

table.description: The ECU uses various flags and counters to determine ignition advance. The value from this table represents the primary ignition advance.
